citations.narrative:
The cage cards on the primary enclosures for 20 puppies did not include a unique number identifying each puppy. Failure
to identify puppies with a unique identification number makes it difficult to keep track of puppies born, raised, or died.
Licensee must keep and maintain records on APHIS form 7005, or on cage cards placed on the animals' primary
enclosure for puppies under 16 weeks of age which include a unique identification number for each puppy. Correct by
October 1, 2023.

There were no dates recorded for when the annual parvovirus and distemper vaccines were last given since 2022 for the
adult dogs. Failure to record the dates of all vaccines and treatments administered to adult dogs makes it difficult to track
if vaccines and treatments are being done as prescribed in the written program of veterinary care (APHIS form 7002A).
Licensee must record the dates of all vaccines and treatments given to the adult dogs to ensure adequate veterinary care
is provided. Correct by October 1, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(1)(vi) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The cage cards on the primary enclosures for 20 puppies did not include a unique number identifying each puppy. Failure 
to identify puppies with a unique identification number makes it difficult to keep track of puppies born, raised, or died. 
Licensee must keep and maintain records on APHIS form 7005, or on cage cards placed on the animals' primary 
enclosure for puppies under 16 weeks of age which include a unique identification number for each puppy. Correct by 
October 1, 2023. 
3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
There were no dates recorded for when the annual parvovirus and distemper vaccines were last given since 2022 for the 
adult dogs. Failure to record the dates of all vaccines and treatments administered to adult dogs makes it difficult to track 
if vaccines and treatments are being done as prescribed in the written program of veterinary care (APHIS form 7002A). 
Licensee must record the dates of all vaccines and treatments given to the adult dogs to ensure adequate veterinary care 
is provided. Correct by October 1, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
 n
